internship.description: A sales support app for easy schedule adjustment with a smartphone
internship.overviewText: During my 2-day internship at Knowledge Work Inc, I participated in a design exploration project centered around the challenge of efficiently scheduling meetings.
internship.scenarioIntro: The project was inspired by the following hypothetical scenario, provided by the company:
internship.scenarioBullet1: {A} needed a new meeting time after the first consultation.
internship.scenarioBullet4: Before proposing times to {C} and {D}, {A} confirmed availability with {B}.
internship.scenarioBullet5: {A} then presented the options to {C} and {D}.
internship.scenarioBullet6: {C} coordinated with {D} for a common time.
internship.scenarioBullet8: Finally, {C} provided a mutually agreed time to {A}.
internship.role: As a UI/UX design intern, my role involved conducting user research, creating wireframes, designing user interfaces...
internship.designProcessText: The design process involved a combination of research, prototyping, and testing.
internship.infoGathering: I began by reviewing existing scheduling apps, and conducting competitive analysis. This research helped me identify key user needs and pain points.
internship.prototyping: After the research, I created low-fidelity wireframes from selecting candidate date and time to requesting them for the companion. I then conducted usability testing with a sales person at the company I participated.
internship.improvements: Based on the results of our usability testing, I made several key improvements to the design, including the fact that travel time needs to be considered as well as available slots, and adding clearer instructions. These improvements significantly enhanced the overall user experience.
internship.conditionSearchText: Search by "Refine by criteria" at the top of the calendar view (companion / business target / location / duration)
internship.searchResultsText1: The "Search results" view dims the surrounding area, highlighting the specified period (from the 5th to the 9th). Results are presented in a list view at the bottom on the page, and users can easily adjust the time by tapping the right arrow.
internship.searchResultsText2: In Day view of the calendar, the meeting time and the travel time displayed, eliminating the need to worry about travel time.
internship.sendRequestText: The screen transitions to the confirmation page about the detail.
internship.impressionsPoint1: The most impressive part was interviewing the sales staff and receiving valuable feedback on the designs at that point in time.
internship.impressionsPoint2: The reactions of the designers during the presentation were impressive; they took the students' work seriously and reacted with large nods of their heads.
internship.impressionsPoint3: Feedback was provided in the form of a set of good points (GOOD), opportunities for improvement (OPPORTUNITY) and areas for improvement (IMPROVE).
internship.reflectionPoint1: As mentioned above, I got an opportunity to interview a sales person and his feedback provided me with more practical design ideas. For me, the interview was my first experience and very valuable.
internship.reflectionPoint2: I received realistic advice for improvement that I need to consider not only available slots but also travel time. I learned not only to consider the usability and usability of the application, but also the perspective of what users want to use this application in what environment and for what purpose.
internship.reflectionPoint3: As for the function to obtain location information of each individual, I felt that privacy concerns and the fact that some people register locations in their calendars while others do not, were challenges in connecting design with the real world.

gymDashboard.overviewText: My 24-hour gym had unpredictable crowd conditions, making it impossible to plan efficient training schedules. Particularly during evening hours, long wait times prevented effective use of limited exercise time. This project built a system that optimizes gym usage through a data-driven approach.
gymDashboard.challengesIntro: This project built a distributed system integrating 4 platforms (iOS, iCloud, GitHub Actions, Vercel) and tackled the following technical challenges:
gymDashboard.dataCollectionSemiAuto: Data Collection Semi-Automation: From screenshot acquisition to iCloud sync under iOS constraints
gymDashboard.ocrAccuracyImprovement: OCR Accuracy Improvement: Achieved 80% OCR processing success rate through image preprocessing
gymDashboard.cicdIntegration: CI/CD Integration: Fully automated pipeline with GitHub Actions
gymDashboard.dataVisualization: Data Visualization: Interactive dashboard with Next.js + Chart.js
gymDashboard.operationOptimization: Operation Optimization: Robust infrastructure achieving 99.1% uptime
gymDashboard.roleDescription: I was consistently responsible for the entire system architecture design, implementation, and operation, demonstrating practical skills in creative problem-solving under constrained environments and integration of multiple technical domains.
gymDashboard.systemFlowDescription: The diagram is the visualization for the flow of this project:
gymDashboard.ocrSuccessRate: OCR Processing Success Rate: 80% (Tesseract + OpenCV preprocessing)
gymDashboard.designProcessText: In designing a complex system that integrates multiple technical domains, I adopted a phased approach. I proceeded systematically from personal problem-solving through understanding technical constraints to implementation.
gymDashboard.designStep1Body: Analysis of gym user behavior patterns and identification of pain points. Investigation of technical constraints (iOS automation limitations, OCR accuracy constraints) and feasibility assessment.
gymDashboard.designStep2Body: Distributed system design for iOS → iCloud → GitHub Actions → Vercel. End-to-end design from screenshot acquisition to dashboard display.
gymDashboard.designStep3Body: OCR accuracy optimization through image preprocessing. Resolution of synchronization issues between 4 platforms and UX optimization.
gymDashboard.dataCollectionText1: My gym's dedicated app is only accessible through a closed iOS app with no web version, making complete automation technically impossible. Therefore, I designed a "context-aware semi-automation" system that achieved sustainable data collection integrated into my natural behavior flow.
gymDashboard.dataCollectionText2: Initially, I configured Apple Shortcut to perform OCR within Automation and extract time, number of people, and crowd labels, but text corruption and unwanted text extraction occurred. Therefore, I changed the design to specialize Apple Shortcut for screenshot capturing and saving to iCloud Drive with datetime filenames, while performing OCR processing on the GitHub Actions side.
gymDashboard.alertInitialDesignDescription: OCR performed within Apple Shortcut, causing text corruption and unwanted text extraction
gymDashboard.alertOptimizedDesignDescription: Apple Shortcut specialized for screenshot capture and iCloud saving, OCR processing moved to GitHub Actions
gymDashboard.ocrText1: I learned that image preprocessing is more important than expected for OCR accuracy improvement. Initially, I performed OCR processing within Apple Shortcut, but text corruption and unwanted text extraction occurred, so I moved the processing to the GitHub Actions side.
gymDashboard.ocrText2: I implemented 3-stage image preprocessing using OpenCV:
gymDashboard.ocrStep1: Grayscale Conversion (cv2.cvtColor) - Convert color images to a more processable format
gymDashboard.ocrStep2: Noise Removal (cv2.fastNlMeansDenoising) - Effectively remove image noise
gymDashboard.ocrStep3: Adaptive Contrast Enhancement (cv2.createCLAHE) - Clarify character outlines
gymDashboard.ocrText3Middle: as the main engine with Japanese and English support (jpn+eng), and
gymDashboard.ocrText3After: is disabled for performance optimization. I have accumulated 354 data points and built a stable data collection pipeline.
gymDashboard.githubActionsSuccess: After 7 failures with GitHub Actions, I achieved initial success on the 8th attempt.
gymDashboard.failureCausesProcess: The main failure causes and resolution process are as follows.
gymDashboard.decisiveFixTextMiddle: package was deprecated in Ubuntu 24.04 environment with a single change to
gymDashboard.syncStep2: Local side: launchd script Git integration fix
gymDashboard.syncResult: This enabled the hybrid system (local iCloud sync + GitHub Actions processing) to work properly, achieving 99.1% uptime.
gymDashboard.learningText1: Through this project, I experienced the joy of solving small daily problems with technology. While I initially aimed for complete automation, finding the "right level of automation" with manual operation when launching the gym app was a significant learning.
gymDashboard.learningText2: Technically, I faced an unexpected challenge where BOT commits from GitHub Actions do not trigger Vercel's automatic deployment. In solving this problem, I gained deep understanding of CI/CD pipeline mechanisms and inter-service coordination.
gymDashboard.prospectsText: Currently, data acquisition timing is unstable as it depends on when I remember to do it, so I haven't achieved regular and stable data collection like acquiring data at 0 minutes of every hour. I expect that future AI developments will enable Siri to operate apps, or Shortcuts will evolve to allow more advanced configurations, making more complete automation possible.
